page.title: 04Basket Making
page.content: Withies are the thin twigs which grow on willow trees.They grow beside a ditch because they need a lot of water.Some withies are grown in special beds near the basket works so they are handy for the basket makers.On the road from Burrowbridge to Lyng there is a place where they make baskets.They grow the withies on the land behind the shop.There were three different colours.The dark brown ones have been steamed with the bark still on.The light brown ones have been boiled for a short time with the bark still on.The white ones have had the bark taken off while they are still fresh.We watched the men making the baskets.They sat on the floor and worked so fast that I could hardly see what they were doing.In the shop and outside we saw the baskets, cots and stools they had made.
